form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hyde-Smith introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the limitation with respect to the aggregate reduction in fair market value of farmland for purposes of application of the estate tax.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Ensure Rural Inheritance Transfers Are Generationally Enduring Act or the HERITAGE Act.

section.header: Increase in limitation on aggregate reduction in fair market value of farmland

subsection.text: Section 2032A(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking shall not exceed $750,000 and inserting:

subparagraph.text: in the case of qualified real property which was being used for a qualified use described in subparagraph (A) of subsection (b)(2), $15,000,000, and
in the case of qualified real property which was being used for a qualified use described in subparagraph (B) of such subsection, $750,000.

subsection.text: Section 2032A(a)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking the $750,000 amount and inserting each dollar amount, and
in subparagraph (A), by striking $750,000 and inserting such dollar amount.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to the estates of decedents dying after the date of the enactment of this Act.
